intro: Ilex ternatiflora, commonly known as the Florida holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Aquifoliaceae. It is native to the southeastern United States, particularly Florida and parts of Georgia. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage, with dark green, leathery leaves that are typically alternate in arrangement. It produces small, yellowish-white flowers in the spring, which are followed by bright red berries in the fall. Ilex ternatiflora is often used in landscaping due to its ornamental value and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
